data.name: btnAutoSearch
data.value: Automatically search for well-fitting control points for both curves. Three other points per control point are recursively tried. The search distance is Error / 50 (vertical only). If no better points are found, four other points per control point are tried, and so on. If the improvement through different control point positions is less than 10%, the degree of the curve is increased by 1. Then search again. This continues until the error is less than 0.075. The search can be interrupted with the stop button.

data.name: btnAxisAuto
data.value: Resets the Zoom to fit Data.

data.name: btnDecreaseOrderBottom
data.value: Decrease the order of the bottom bezier curve while preserving the shape.

data.name: btnDecreaseOrderTop
data.value: Decrease the order of the top bezier curve while preserving the shape.

data.name: btnDefault
data.value: Load the default control points.

data.name: btnIncreaseOrderBottom
data.value: Increase the order of the bottom bezier curve while preserving the shape.

data.name: btnIncreaseOrderTop
data.value: Increase the order of the top bezier curve while preserving the shape.

data.name: btnLoadBez
data.value: Load control points from a .bez file.

data.name: btnLoadBezDat
data.value: Load control points from a .bez.dat file.

data.name: btnLoadDat
data.value: Load a reference airfoil from a .dat file. Right-click to remove the reference airfoil.

data.name: btnSaveBez
data.value:
Save the current control points as a .bez file. The formatting differs from normal .dat files. The control points at the LE and TE don't have to be identical for the top and bottom curves. This allows the definition of other geometry as bezier curves, for example, the wing planform. Currently, this is not supported by other software, but theoretically it is a better file type. File format example:
Airfoil Name Top Start 0.00000000 0.00000000 0.00000000 0.15000000 0.50000000 0.15000000 1.00000000 0.00000000 Top End Bottom Start 0.00000000 0.00000000 0.00000000 -0.10000000 0.50000000 -0.10000000 1.00000000 0.00000000 Bottom End

data.name: btnSaveBezDat
data.value:
Save the current control points as a .bez.dat file. The formatting is identical to normal .dat files. This allows the control points to be easily loaded into most other programs. File format example:
Airfoil Name 1.00000000 0.00000000 0.50000000 0.15000000 0.00000000 0.15000000 0.00000000 0.00000000 0.00000000 -0.10000000 0.50000000 -0.10000000 1.00000000 0.00000000

data.name: btnSaveDat
data.value: Save the current curves as a .dat file.

data.name: btnSearchBottom
data.value: Search for better control points for the bottom curve.

data.name: btnSearchTop
data.value: Search for better control points for the top curve.

data.name: btnStopSearch
data.value: Stop the currently running search.

data.name: chkShowBottom
data.value: Show or hide the bottom curve.

data.name: chkShowCamber
data.value: Show or hide the camber line.

data.name: chkShowControlBottom
data.value: Show or hide the control points for the bottom curve.

data.name: chkShowControlTop
data.value: Show or hide the control points for the top curve.

data.name: chkShowRadius
data.value: Show or hide the leading edge radius.

data.name: chkShowReferenceBottom
data.value: Show or hide the bottom of the reference airfoil.

data.name: chkShowReferenceTop
data.value: Show or hide the top of the reference airfoil.

data.name: chkShowThickness
data.value: Show or hide the thickness distribution.

data.name: chkShowTop
data.value: Show or hide the top curve.

data.name: txtCamberPosition
data.value: Set the position at which the camber line is calculated.

data.name: txtCamberStepSize
data.value: Set the step size at which the camber line is calculated.

data.name: txtChord
data.value: Sets the chord used during export.

data.name: txtNumOfPointBottom
data.value: Set the number of points on the bottom bezier curve.

data.name: txtNumOfPointsTop
data.value: Set the number of points on the top bezier curve.

data.name: txtThicknessStepSize
data.value: Set the step size at which the thickness line is calculated.
